Key Match Events: Sunil Chhetri played his final match for India in a 0-0 draw against Kuwait.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made several crucial saves to keep India in the game.
Rahim Ali missed a significant chance to score in the second half.
Edmund Lalrindika became the first player in 5 years to play for India from the I-League.
Pre-Game Insights: Sunil Chhetri expressed his desire to focus on the team rather than his farewell, emphasizing the importance of winning the match against Kuwait.
Coach Igor Stimac highlighted the need for India to be aggressive and clinical in front of goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Sunil Chhetri was emotional as he received a guard of honour from his teammates and walked off the field for the last time.
Coach Igor Stimac reflected on the team's lack of aggression and clinical finishing, praising Gurpreet Singh Sandhu's performance.
Viren Rasquinha expressed concerns about the state of Indian football after the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under an overcast sky at Salt Lake Stadium in Kolkata.
The draw severely dents India's chances of advancing to the next stage of the World Cup qualifiers.
Sunil Chhetri ended his international career with 94 goals in 151 matches.
